image.altText: A man with skin cancers sits in a chair in Darwin.

props.synopsis: After decades of radiation, melanoma removals and skin grafts, Leigh Raaschou says he wishes there had been other options years ago to deal with skin cancers.

title.children: Cannabis treatment could offer glint of hope for sufferers of one of Australia's worst cancers

image.altText: Shane Drumgold out the front of the ACT courts.

props.synopsis: The ACT's former top prosecutor Shane Drumgold has succeeded in challenging some findings made against him in an inquiry into the prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Former prosecutor succeeds in challenging inquiry findings into Bruce Lehrmann prosecution

image.altText: A man holding a bunch of bananas and a banh mi.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing nearly a billion dollars a year in card surcharges, which could be substantially reduced when a system called least-cost routing is fully implemented.

title.children: Australians lose nearly $1 billion a year to card surcharges as RBA warns banks to stop

image.altText: A male golfer celebrates cheering in front of a large group of fans

props.synopsis: One talented child in a family is exceptional. Two is extraordinary. Siblings Minjee and Min Woo Lee are both big stars on the golf circuit … but they couldn’t be more different.

title.children: Part-time golfer, full-time 'cook': How an Aussie sportsman has reached cult status

image.altText: Gough Whitlam in grey suit, blue striped tie, pours soil into Indigenous man Vincent Lingiari who wears blue shirt, tie.

props.synopsis: Gurindji traditional owners want schoolkids and tourists to be able to walk the old fence line Vincent Lingiari and his people followed in the 60s. But they say the heritage area's condition is "really sad".

title.children: It's one of Australia's most famous photos, but the birthplace of land rights has seen better days

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower at lunchtime, led by losses in utilities and health care. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX trading lower, job ads down in February

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Extreme weather damage over summer hits $1.2 billion
Building approvals keep slumping, despite an apartment rebound
Miners and financial firms rake in the profits, retailers go backwards and GDP looks shaky

image.altText: Prince Charles greets a crowd of people waving Australian flags and holding up mobile phones

props.synopsis: The federal government is preparing for a potential royal visit to Australia later this year by beginning talks with the states and territories about when and where King Charles and Queen Camilla might travel.

title.children: King Charles may visit Australia this year despite recent cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: ASIC is alleging Dave Hodgson and two of his companies provided unlicensed financial services and made misrepresentations to investors. Mr Hodgson, who is the proponent behind what he claims would be a "clean" coal-to-hydrogen project in Tasmania says he will "mount a very strong defence".

title.children: 'They crucified Jesus, now us': Supporters rally around businessman being sued by ASIC

image.altText: a man smiles as he poses holding a black and white dog

props.synopsis: The sentencing of David McBride next week will be a clarifying moment for whistleblowing protections in this country, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: The US pays its whistleblowers instead of sending them to prison. Should Australia do the same?

image.altText: Hayley Harris is an ADHD bride trying on a wedding dress at the bridal shop English Rose Bridal in Perth

props.synopsis: Planning a wedding is daunting for anyone, but for people with a disability it can be overwhelming. Three people who have done it share their tips on making a truly magical day, without burning out in the process.

title.children: Hayley thought with her ADHD, she could plan her wedding in just two weeks. And she almost did

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The relief among Labor MPs and officials was palpable, but the celebratory speeches at the Liberal Party function did appear incongruous with the stark reality of an election loss, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: The stark reality is Dutton's 'working-class' strategy wasn't a hit with voters

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: A "top priority" investigation, numerous police interviews and a supportive community effort have been features of a search in the month since Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy disappeared.

title.children: No new leads and a tight lid on protracted investigation — what we know about Samantha Murphy's disappearance

image.altText: two piggy banks on an orange background

props.synopsis: People might be surprised how common it is for couples to keep finances separate, says financial adviser Kate McCallum. But is it a good idea, and how do they make it work?

title.children: Not all couples want to share finances. Here's how to make it fair

image.altText: A composite image of Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam and Sydney Roosters' Spencer Leniu during their NRL season opener in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: As the NRL investigates an allegation of a racial slur in the marquee game of the NRL Las Vegas showpiece, Brisbane Broncos coach Kevin Walters says his five-eighth was upset in the rooms after the match and "adamant" Spencer Leniu racially abused him.

title.children: Broncos and Roosters clash in Vegas hotel after allegation of racial abuse in NRL season opener

image.altText: a hand pulls out the ASEAN flag for a camera against a black background

props.synopsis: Nine South-East Asian leaders will descend on Melbourne today for the three-day ASEAN-Australia summit. Here's a look at what each leader might hope to achieve, and some of the flashpoints that could emerge during discussions.

title.children: As Albanese prepares to greet South-East Asia's heavyweights, he faces some potentially delicate negotiations

image.altText: A composite image of Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam and Sydney Roosters' Spencer Leniu during their NRL season opener in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: Broncos five-eighth Ezra Mam makes a formal complaint against Roosters recruit Spencer Leniu during Brisbane's 20-10 loss in their season opener in Las Vegas.

title.children: Alleged racial comment by star Roosters recruit mars win over Broncos in NRL Vegas opener

image.altText: A fan celebrates during a rugby league game in Las Vegas

props.synopsis: A new sport won't crack the home of the brave overnight and one week of fun and footy in Las Vegas doesn't prove anything. But it was a pretty good start.

title.children: NRL facing uphill battle to conquer the US, but claims a thrilling toehold in Las Vegas

image.altText: A photo of a castle at night in a forest, with everything all lit up by lights.

props.synopsis: Mark and Judy Evans purchased a dilapidated tourist spot with its very own castle 30 years ago. They say its success is due to the park's 100-year history.

title.children: There's an almost 100-year-old castle in a Queensland rainforest. How did it get there?

image.altText: Three generations of women stand together, Pounamu is 18, then her grandmother Ihapera, 66, and mother Natasha, 40.

props.synopsis: Last century, children were forced to write lines of 'I will not speak Māori' as punishment. Now as grandparents, they fear progress around the use of the Māori language is at stake.

title.children: 'I will not speak Māori': Fears new policies in NZ threaten 50 years of progress

image.altText: A ham and cheese toasted sandwich wrapped in baking paper.

props.synopsis: Traffic light systems, "sometimes foods" and everyday heroes — nutritionists and school staff unpack everything you need to know about how tuckshop menus are decided.

title.children: Ham and cheese sandwiches are off the menu for some schools, who decides what's served at your child's tuckshop?

image.altText: A calculator on a table with an electricity bill, phone, and pens

props.synopsis: With electricity bills still high, we've compiled a list of the energy-draining appliances that may be spiking your power bill and how to cut costs.

title.children: The six biggest energy guzzlers in your home driving up your power bill — and the best way to run them efficiently

image.altText: A close-up picture of a man handing over a set of house keys to a woman.

props.synopsis: It might make sense financially, but there are potential emotional pitfalls in accepting support from family to get into the property market.

title.children: The hidden costs of borrowing from the 'Bank of Mum and Dad'

image.altText: ambulance and cars parked on side of street

props.synopsis: Emergency workers worked through the night to retrieve the body of a woman in her 20s who fell to her death on a hike in the Lamington National Park.

title.children: Woman falls to death at popular waterfall in Gold Coast national park

image.altText: A young girl playing pinball next to a man

props.synopsis: At 10, Emily Cosson was the only female at pinball competitions. Then she started beating the grown men. Now, she's part of a trend turning old-school cool again.

title.children: Digital natives resurgence in the popular arcade game has seen world rankings taken over by under 21-year-olds

image.altText: Palm Cove Beach surrounded by palm trees near Cairns

props.synopsis: Conde Nast Traveller magazine's list of the world's best 34 beaches features six Australian locations.

title.children: Palm Cove crowned world's best beach as Australia dominates list

image.altText: Nathan Lyon celebrates

props.synopsis: Nathan Lyon gets flipped around and rips through the New Zealand line-up, while Rachin Ravindra shows he has plenty to learn in his fledgling Test career. Here are the five quick hits from the fourth day of the first Test at Basin Reserve.

title.children: Five quick hits — Lyon stars, Green prevails and NZ star learns a lesson in Australia's 172-run victory

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: While the Dunkley by-election did nothing to change the electoral map, it offers insights into how Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton will battle the next federal election.

title.children: This by-election changed nothing but it could ultimately change everything

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: You won a trivia night once? Cute. Now it’s time to play, HARD!

image.altText: Hannah Green, with the Australian flag draped over her shoulders, holds the LPGA Tour Women's World Championship trophy.

props.synopsis: With birdies on the final three holes, Australia's Hannah Green takes out the LGPA Tour's Women's World Championship with a one-stroke victory in Singapore.

title.children: Aussie Green wins LGPA Tour's Women's World Championship

image.altText: A collection of makeup brushes of different sizes and thickness in a cup

props.synopsis: From the bristles of brushes to the porous surfaces of sponges, your makeup kit can harbour a host of bacteria and fungi. Here's what you need to know about keeping things hygenic.

title.children: How often do I need to wash makeup brushes and sponges?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Dunkley candidate Jodie Belyea and his fiancé Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition insists it is well-placed to win Labor seats at the next election despite falling short in a Victorian by-election last night.

title.children: Coalition optimistic about political fortunes despite Labor retaining Dunkley in by-election

props.synopsis: The sunken vessel spills fertiliser and oil into the Red Sea, threatening a vibrant fishing industry, some of the world's largest coral reefs and desalination plants supplying millions with drinking water.

title.children: Cargo ship attacked by Houthi rebels sinks in Red Sea

image.altText: Close up of a woman crying, tears streaming down cheeks

props.synopsis: Grief is raw, complex, often fraught — and "moving on" from a loss is rarely straightforward or linear.

title.children: Grieving is more complex than 'moving on' and 'getting over it'

image.altText: People sit and look at the camera as they wait inside a hospital in Gaza

props.synopsis: Israel's military says a preliminary review of civilian deaths at a Gaza aid convoy last week finds forces did not strike the convoy and that "the majority" of Palestinians killed died in a stampede, contradicting accounts from witnesses and doctors who treated the injured.

title.children: Israeli military says review of Gaza aid convoy deaths found most killed in stampede, not IDF fire

image.altText: Police escort protesters out of the Mardi Gras parade.

props.synopsis: Nine pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested on Oxford Street as thousands of revellers took part in Mardi Gras festivities on Saturday, which this year also honoured Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Protesters arrested at Sydney Mardi Gras as thousands turn out to celebrate
